I spent about an hour feeling through minifigure packets to find this one.
There are two Dark Tan wands, and all of the exquisitely printed minifig parts.

This is a good depiction of Graves. His face(s) look good, I like that you can transform him into Grindelwald, and the torso/legs are awesome. But the thing is, there is pretty much nothing special about this guy. He is just another great minifigure like the others in the series. Unfortunately, LEGO has made him very rare, so be prepared

column2: One per case. That is what LEGO did for this final figure in the Series and it means it was very hard to acquire. If you are interested in owning one of these you will need to go to the secondary market and pay for one, or find a sealed case for yourself to pick through which is harder and harder to come by these days.

column1: Percival features a very impressive looking print, with side-arm detailing for his sleeves and a very nice long jacket visible on the front of the torso and legs. He has a suit under the jacket with a tie clearly visible and further detailing on the back for the jacket. His hair is black with greying shown off via printed bottom of the hair piece. He has an unassuming looking face with thick eyebrows and a smile on one side. Flip the head around, swap out for the included white hair piece and Gellert Grindlewald is revealed in all his sinister glory. The expression on that side matches up with the facial expressions on the Grindlewald Minifigure from 2018.

The secret is easy to discover by his wand, which uses the same colour and style as Dumbledore, meaning this too is the Elder Wand. Overall a very frustrating though pleasant surprise from Series 1 and if you desire to own this version of the character I would recommend tracking one down. Highly Sought-After and Highly Recommended.
